author: Special Correspondent
text:
QUITE IMPORTANT:Drivers plying vehicles to schools underwent a health check-up in Erode on Monday, as part of Road Safety Week observance.- PHOTO: M. GOVARTHAN

About 110 drivers plying buses, vans, and auto rickshaws to schools were screened on Monday for eye problems and other health conditions under the aegis of Road Safety Week observance.

The free medical check-up conducted by the Transport Department was carried out by Chief Eye Surgeon of Government Headquarters Hospital Ravikumar, and his team, and the general check-up was conducted by another team from IRT Perundurai Medical College. Dr. Ravikumar recommended further eye-treatment for 12 drivers.

The drivers were given medicines free of cost. Some of them did not know about prevalence of diabetes and blood pressure until the check-up, Regional Transport Officer Ramalingam said.

He advised the drivers to keep their mind and body fit for safe driving. The moment yawning occurs, the drivers ought to take it as an indication for stopping the vehicle for taking a nap, he said.

The drivers were also given first-aid orientation.
title: 110 drivers undergo free eye, general check-up
